thread.title: Big boost for Pakistan ahead of AUS vs PAK 3rd Test, Haris Rauf joins visitors camp
thread.title_full: Big boost for Pakistan ahead of AUS vs PAK 3rd Test, Haris Rauf joins visitors camp

author: Pranchal Srivastava
title: Big boost for Pakistan ahead of AUS vs PAK 3rd Test, Haris Rauf joins visitors camp
text: In a massive boost for Pakistan, express pacer Haris Rauf has joined the camp ahead of the AUS vs PAK 3rd Test. To note Haris Rauf was taking part in the ongoing Big Bash League (BBL) as his national side suffered another Test series defeat down under. However, the right-arm pacer is likely to take part in the AUS vs PAK 3rd Test starting on January 3 (Wednesday). Earlier, Haris Rauf suffered a lot of criticism from the former cricketers for not being a part of the ongoing AUS vs PAK Test series. Veteran Shahid Afridi also spoke about it stating that Rauf would have enjoyed the challenge of bowling on Australian-prepared fields in Perth and Melbourne. “I think Haris [Rauf] should be part of this side instead rather than [the BBL]. In these conditions, the kind of pace he has, he would have performed well and enjoyed himself on the kinds of pitches Australia prepared in Perth and here,” Afridi, speaking to media at the MCG, said. Also Read: SA vs IND 2nd Test: Sunil Gavaskar proposes 2 changes in Cape Town after crushing loss SKY out, Hardik out, Rohit not interested, Who will lead India in Afghanistan T20Is? Ranji Trophy 2024: Mohammed Shami’s brother gets maiden call-up for Bengal Ranji team India squad for Afghanistan series next week, Rohit Sharma likely to return Haris Rauf has played only one Test Rauf has played only one Test match so far. The 30-year-old played his debut match in December 2022 against England. During that match in Rawalpindi, the right-arm pacer bowled just 13 overs and gave away 78 runs before his maiden Test wicket. It remains to be seen if the express pacer can make any difference in the third and final Test match to be played at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG).
